page.title: 07HOUSING IN ROTHERHAM
page.content: {Housing in Rotherham.} Rotherham houses date back to the turn of the century. Many older terraced houses have been demolished, those remaining being modernised with the aid of council grants. Broom is an area of mainly semi-detached houses built in the 1930's whereas Brinsworth rapidly expanded in the 1950's. The newest area is Moorgate consisting mainly of larger, detached dwellings. The rate of growth of population in the borough is one of the fastest in the country. This may well be attributed to its having one of the youngest populations. Consequently land is being made available for future housing developments to meet the new demand. The planning department is currently redrawing the Green Belt boundary to safeguard the many areas of natural beauty.
